Patent Information.Abstract: Antifungal proteins which are analogues of the Rs-AFP2 protein and contain particular mutations in their amino acid sequence. The mutated proteins possess enhanced salt-tolerant antifungal activity. The proteins are useful for combating fungal diseases in agricultural, pharmaceutical or preservative applications.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Fungi:Alternaria brassicola (IC50=3 µg/ml), Botrytis cinerea(IC50=1.5 µg/ml), Fusarium culmorum (IC50=2 µg/ml), Fusarium oxysporum f.sp. lycopersici (IC50=1.8 µg/ml), Pyricularia oryzae (IC50=0.25 µg/ml), Verticiliium dahliae (IC50=0.8 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Possesses antifungal activity sensitive to inorganic cations.
Sequence Information.Subunit structure: Forms oligomers in its native state.

Literature.Title: A new family of basic cysteine-rich plant antifungal proteins from Brassicaceae species.
Literature.Author: Terras FR, Torrekens S, Van Leuven F, Osborn RW, Vanderleyden J, Cammue BP, Broekaert WF.
